job_title: Annonymus Employee in Havre de Grace, MD
pros: The people on campus are very nice and great to work with. You feel like part of a family. Management is understanding when you are sick or need to request time off. Job security. Yearly bonus. You can access free coffee, fruit, and snacks from the dining area.
cons: The corporate end does not seem to listen to the employees that work on the campus. Lack of communication. Almost no chance to receive a raise or grow within the company. (If you have a degree in certain areas, this may not apply to you.) You are lucky to receive benefits.

job_title: Manager in Havre de Grace, MD

There is no leadership, just dictatorship, there is no care or concern for anything, just damage control. It's like a bunch of chick's running around that have absolutely no clue what they're doing.

review_title: Mistakes are the death of an employee
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Bel Air, MD
pros: Benefits are excellent and pay is great.
cons: They nit pick and act like you cannot make a mistake yet after 2 weeks of training you get thrown in to the position because no one else can do it. But when you work extra hard to do a job that they themselves realize after you leave is too hectic, they give you one chance and if you fail they let the rip cord go. Management is horribly judgmental and somewhat two faced and allow bullying but make you the bad guy and write you up for things that they caused to happen. But when another person trained you that way , they do not get in trouble for causing the mistake. They are allowed to get away with it. Guess I was the wrong color as well because the other nurse did NO work when filling in but was praised for doing ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. During the pandemic, they are cold hearted. No respect for the work I achieved that all the other coworkers said was more than previous employee had attempted.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Havre de Grace, MD
pros: Free parking, beautiful campus and view of the water.
cons: This used to be a great place to work but current management treats employees as disposable with no focus on retention, especially when it comes to female employees.  No recognition for hard work and constant nitpicking about everything. Staff always afraid of being punished for minor mistakes which resulted in a stressful environment when it wasn’t necessary. If you prefer autonomy and control over your work…. this is not the place for you. The ideal employee is a ‘yes’ man with no leadership skills or ability to be creative or innovative.

job_title: Intake Coordinator in Havre de Grace, MD
pros: Good benefits, free meals, nice campus
cons: Consistently short staffed and easily burned out. A lot of turn over. Management could be better with communication. Often told things too late or last minute. People are constantly worried they are going to be fired for small mistakes.

job_title: Counselor in Havre de Grace, MD
pros: It is very rewarding working with addicts and alcoholics. The campus sits on a beautiful piece of property overlooking Chesapeake Bay; it is a very tranquil setting.
cons: When the place was Father Martin's Ashley, it had much more of a family atmosphere for employees that I believe that spread to the patients. Over the past several years they took Father Martin's name off of everything and grew into a typical, sterile corporate beast. Benefits have been reduced and cut, despite the nonprofit status and over $75,000,000.00 in income producing investments, millions of dollars in donations per year and the income generating treatment center. The Catholic priest CEO makes over $300,000 a year plus over $30,000 in bonuses and drives a company Lexus,  that same man poor-mouthes that the company can't afford bonuses or raises for the regular employees, yet he and his top income earners never take a personal hit.

job_title: Vice President Business Development in Havre de Grace, MD
pros:
Ashley is a special place with a rich, deep history. In our 35+ years, we've served approximately 40,000 patients and put them on the path to healing and lifelong recovery. 

In January, 2018, we hired a new President & CEO, and she is directing us through a period of growth, improvement, and positive change. I'm very optimistic about what the future holds. 

The facility is stunning. 

Very favorable benefit packages.
cons: The work is challenging but no different than many other facets of healthcare.
